definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)

sentences.english: The neighbor often borrowed my inflator.
sentences.chinese: 鄰居經常借我家的打氣筒。

sentences.english: Somebody else lent me a pump and helped me mend the puncture.
sentences.chinese: 別人借給我一個打氣筒，又幫我補好了輪胎。

sentences.english: We use a pump to blow air into our tires.
sentences.chinese: 我們使用打氣筒把氣打進輪胎。

sentences.english: Can you lend me your bicycle pump?
sentences.chinese: 能把你的打氣筒借給我嗎？

sentences.english: I bought a bike with its pump.
sentences.chinese: 我買了一部連打氣筒的自行車。

sentences.english: I carried a repair kit12 and pump with me so I could mend tires on the go.
sentences.chinese: 我隨身帶着修理工具和打氣筒，這樣我可以隨時補胎。

sentences.english: The utility model discloses an air inflating cylinder incorporated with bicycle which is an improvement of bicycle inflator technique.
sentences.chinese: 隨車型打氣筒是一種自行車打氣筒的技術改進。

sentences.english: The utility model discloses an air inflating cylinder incorporated with bicycle which is an improvement of bicycle inflator technique.
sentences.chinese: 隨車型打氣筒是一種自行車打氣筒的技術改進。

sentences.english: A bicycle pump can be used to pump air into a bicycle tyre.
sentences.chinese: 自行車打氣筒可用來把氣打入車胎。
是個小型的自行車打氣筒。

sentences.english: Do you have a bicycle pump ?
sentences.chinese: 我買了一部連打氣筒的自行車。

sentences.english: And that really is the bicycle pump.
sentences.chinese: 這正是自行車打氣筒的情況。

sentences.english: If bicycle pump, then the alignment hole- by-blow look at a better effect.
sentences.chinese: 如有自行車打氣筒，則對準小孔逐個吹一下效果更佳。

sentences.english: Did you remember to bring the pump?

definition: lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
to whisper to one another's ear
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
